intro: Myriocarpa bifurca, commonly known as the two-branched myriocarpa, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional Aboriginal medicine. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Myriocarpa bifurca is an important species for ecological studies due to its unique adaptations to extreme climates.
